messages.title: UKIP says YES to
messages.content: An NHS free at the point of delivery; No tax on the minimum wage; Housing priority for local people; Affordable energy

messages.title: UKIP says NO to
messages.content: Unlimited immigration; £55m a day membership fees to the EU; £12 billion a year in foreign aid; The 'bedroom tax' and the 'mansion tax'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: An NHS free at the point of delivery with £3 billion extra funding
No tax on the minimum wage to benefit the poorest workers
Priority for local people with an emphasis on low-cost housing on existing sites
Invest in affordable energy from shale gas and nuclear, reduce subsidies in wind and solar farms
Oppose unlimited immigration to prevent lower wages and pressure on housing and services
Eliminate the £55m a day membership fees to the EU
Reduce foreign aid from £12 billion a year, focusing on providing water and fighting diseases
Oppose 'bedroom tax' and 'mansion tax'; simplify the tax and welfare system

issues.brexitEurope: Britain would be better off out of the EU, able to make our own trade.
issues.environment: Reduce subsidies in wind and solar farms.
issues.health: £3 billion extra to the NHS to keep it free.
issues.immigration: The EU’s 'free movement of labour' means lower wages, pressure on health, housing and benefits, and fewer jobs for our children.
issues.socialWelfare: Our welfare system and our taxes should be fair, with simpler tax and welfare systems.

housing.content: Housing priority for local people. We need to build more social and low-cost housing, on existing sites.

contactInformation.address: Lexdrum House, King Charles Business Park, Newton Abbot TQ12 6UT.

images.caption: Campaign leaflet with UKIP policies outlined including messages saying 'YES' to NHS, no tax on minimum wage, housing priority for locals, and affordable energy; and saying 'NO' to unlimited immigration, EU membership fees, large foreign aid, bedroom and mansion tax.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Published by UKIP, Lexdrum House, King Charles Business Park, Newton Abbot TQ12 6UT. Printed by Printbridge, 16 Castle St, Bodmin PL31 2DU.
